skill.name: brainstorming
skill.description: You MUST use this before any creative work - creating features, building components, adding functionality, or modifying behavior. Explores user intent, requirements and design before implementation.
skill.summary: You MUST use this before any creative work - creating features, building components, adding function...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. Only contains markdown instructions for AI behavior. No scripts, network calls, filesystem access beyond project scope, environment variables, or external command execution. Purpose and behavior are fully aligned.

content.value_statement: Developers often start coding before fully understanding requirements, leading to rework and missed features. This skill guides structured exploration of ideas through questions, trade-off analysis, and incremental design validation before writing any code.
actual_capabilities: Asks clarifying questions one at a time to understand user intent
Proposes 2-3 different approaches with trade-offs and recommendations
Presents designs in incremental sections (200-300 words each)
Validates design understanding after each section
Writes design documents to docs/plans/ directory
References related skills for implementation planning
limitations: Does not execute code or interact with external systems
Requires user participation through question responses
Design output depends on quality of user input
Does not generate actual implementation code

use_cases.title: Feature design before coding
use_cases.description: Define new feature requirements and architecture before writing any code, reducing rework later.

use_cases.title: Requirement exploration
use_cases.description: Clarify product requirements through structured dialogue before handing off to engineering.

use_cases.title: Architecture trade-off analysis
use_cases.description: Explore multiple architectural approaches with clear trade-offs before committing to a solution.

prompt_templates.title: New feature idea
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the brainstorming skill to help me design a [feature description]. I want to build something that [describe desired outcome].

prompt_templates.title: Refactoring design
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the brainstorming skill to explore how to refactor [component or module]. Current issues include [list problems].

prompt_templates.title: Integration design
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the brainstorming skill to design how [system A] should integrate with [system B]. Requirements: [list requirements].

prompt_templates.title: Complex feature set
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the brainstorming skill to help me plan [large feature or epic]. This involves [describe scope] and needs to achieve [success criteria].

output_examples.input: Use the brainstorming skill to help me design a user notification system for our app.
output: Let me understand your notification system. First question: What type of notifications do you need to send? (a) In-app only, (b) Email and in-app, (c) Push notifications via mobile, (d) All of the above including SMS
Once you respond, I'll ask about: user preferences, delivery timing, notification types, and integration points before presenting design options...

best_practices: Use this skill at the start of any new feature or significant change
Answer questions thoroughly to get better design output
Request multiple approaches when unsure about the best solution
Commit the generated design document to version control
anti_patterns: Skipping this skill and diving straight into code
Answering multiple questions in a single response
Accepting the first design approach without exploring alternatives
Using this skill for simple tasks that do not require design exploration

faq.question: What AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude Code and standard Claude. Not available on Codex or other AI assistants.

faq.question: How long does the brainstorming process take?
faq.answer: Typical sessions range from 5-15 minutes depending on feature complexity and question responses.

faq.question: Can I use this with existing project documentation?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill checks project state first and references existing docs and commits for context.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-only skill. No data is sent externally or stored beyond the conversation.

faq.question: Why does it ask one question at a time?
faq.answer: Single questions prevent overwhelming users and ensure clearer responses for better design outcomes.

faq.question: How is this different from regular Claude conversations?
faq.answer: This skill enforces a structured design process with specific phases, trade-off analysis, and incremental validation.
